description.narrative: The new phase of DAPP (Danish-Arab Partnership Programme) 2017-2021 - focus on 4 prioritized countries Tunisia, Egypt, Jordan, Morocco. Committed to Youth, Innovation, DEDI, TAO, SNE, public diplomacy/communication, M&E + Reviews

organisation.narrative: The Middle East and Northern Africa

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative:
Innovative methods to enhance diversity, address radicalisation and increase youth participation and influence are shared through bilateral competence building and multilateral events (e.g. DAPP synergy meetings) targeting key stakeholders in the four countries.
Events, trainings and meetings on innovative youth approaches have been held with key stakeholders.

actual.value: 1 - Ministry of Culture and Ministry of Youth in Tunisia have gained knowledge on innovative youth approaches that they can implement in their work; Danish Minister of Development Corporation has been introduced to methods and results of the YCD project.

target.value: Key stakeholders. such as DAPP partners. DUF supported pool partnerships. ministries. governmental and local municipality representatives. and Danish embassies have gained knowledge on innovative youth approaches that they can implement in their work. through their participation in targeted meetings. trainings and events with DUF and DUF partners.

title.narrative:
Innovative methods to enhance diversity, address radicalisation and increase youth participation and influence are tested and documented through testing of new activities such as ‘small scale projects’, festival concepts for youth, use of art and social media to address youth issues, family scouting concepts, ‘Young Voices Forum’, creating ‘ambassadors for equal participation’, and dialogue workshops.
The activity implementation plans include gathering of data for documenting results of the new approaches.

actual.value: 1 - Study documenting methodologies and lessons learned within the YCD project finalized; updated version of the ‘Dialogue Handbook’ published; online facilitation manual developed and distributed in Egypt; a ‘Young Voices Manual,’ a scouts badge and manual on dialogue, and group leader guide on family scout activities developed and distributed in Tunisia.

target.value: A catalogue of experiences concerning new methods and approaches on how key stakeholders can enhance diversity. address radicalisation and increase youth participation and influence is produced.

title.narrative:
Les Scouts Tunisiens implement family scouting as a concept that secures access to civil society participation for young parents.
Family scouting programmes have been implemented in scout groups in marginalised/rural areas, e.g. near the borders of Libya and Algeria and in the suburbs of the large cities.

actual.value: 18 family scout kits distributed to existing scout groups. A guide focusing on group leaders and family scout activities developed.

target.value: 300 family scouting coordinators are trained and do work in local scout groups to include families in 24 districts.

title.narrative:
Les Scouts Tunisiens involve youth and children in marginalised/rural areas in meaningful, organised activities based on youth participation and democratic values.
Local scout groups in marginalised/rural areas have been created or strengthened to function as healthy civic society platforms for youth participation.

actual.value: 23 new volunteers were trained as “Volunteer Organizational Developers”. 44 new scout groups have been established.

target.value: 75 volunteers are trained to conduct at least 1000 local visits aiming at establishing or strengthening local scout groups in Tunisia to function as civic society platforms for youth. 600 local group leaders from 24 districts are trained in leadership and youth inclusive methods.

title.narrative:
Young women and men in Egypt, Jordan and Tunisia are able to use of innovative dialogue tools for promoting peaceful coexistence, countering polarisation and managing diversity.
Ambassadors for Dialogue train and engage young women and men in the target countries in dialogue and diversity.

Organisations, institutions and communities for youth in Egypt, Jordan and Tunisia have enhanced competences in engaging youth from all layers of society in participatory processes.
Ambassadors for Dialogue train organisations, institutions and communities for youth in using dialogue as a tool for youth participation and diversity management.

actual.value: 36 organizations and student chapters in universities trained to perform interactive dialogue workshops focusing on youth participation, diversity and marginalized youth

target.value: At least 36 organisations and student chapters in universities have been trained and can perform interactive dialogue workshops focusing on youth participation. diversity and marginalised youth.

title.narrative:
Young women and men in Egypt, Jordan and Tunisia have capacity to lead change processes as Social Entrepreneurs, Democratic Change Agents and Ambassadors for Dialogue.
Young women and men with potential to take leadership trained in democratic leadership, project management, dialogue and subjects such as diversity and radicalisation in order to become Social Entrepreneurs, Democratic Change Agents or Ambassadors for Dialogue.

Creative methods to enhance diversity, address radicalisation and increase youth participation and influence have gained public publicity through cultural events, social media and communication in Egypt, Jordan, Tunisia and Denmark. Public events and publicity related to enhancing diversity, addressing radicalisation and increasing youth participation and influence have taken place.

actual.value: 5 public events related to enhancing diversity, addressing radicalization and increasing youth participation and influence gain publicity conducted.

target.value: A minimum of 36 public events related to enhancing diversity. addressing radicalisation and increasing youth participation and influence gain publicity. These events in Denmark include public conferences. national scout camps/jamborees. innovative work labs. pop up events. festivals and Folkemødet.

title.narrative:
Young women and men in Egypt, Jordan and Tunisia implement community-building initiatives, with support from a pool for small-scale projects, which aim to influence duty bearers, include marginalised youth in local communities, and increase dialogue and diversity.
The community building initiatives are run solely by young volunteers, and have focus on engaging youth in activism locally in innovative formats focused on local needs assessments.
A small-scale project pool is managed by Les Scouts Tunisiens, WE Center and DEDI.

Organisations and communities for youth in Egypt, Jordan and Tunisia are inclusive platforms with democratic culture and outreach to youth in marginalised areas. A minimum of 37 existing youth organisations and communities for youth have developed their capacity in terms of having outreach to and engaging diverse groups of youth.
The quantitative data will be complemented by qualitative data and descriptions of impact.

New and creative methods to enhance diversity, address radicalisation and increase youth participation and influence are documented and adopted by key stakeholders, incl. duty bearers, DAPP partners and DUF-supported partnerships, and have gained public publicity. Key stakeholders, including DAPP partners, DUF supported pool partnerships, and duty bearers have been involved in initiatives and public events aimed at strengthening their approach to youth engagement through innovative methods and approaches.
The quantitative data will be complemented by qualitative data and descriptions of impact.

target.value: Key stakeholders. incl. DAPP partners. DUF supported pool partnerships. and duty bearers. have built their capacity to increase youth engagement in their structures. programmes or activities.

title.narrative:
Through innovative approaches and methods, young women and men have gained strengthened capacity to act as democratic agents of change and diversity in Egypt, Jordan and Tunisia.
A minimum of 15.000 young women and men have gained specific skills, tools and knowledge that enables them to 1) contribute to a culture of inclusion and diversity, and 2) lead and engage in efforts that contribute to a youth culture of active citizenship.
Measured through young people educated as social entrepreneurs, democratic change agents, ambassadors for dialogue and young people implementing small-scale initiatives or participating in dialogue trainings. The quantitative data will be complemented by qualitative data and descriptions of impact.

target.value: A minimum of 15.000 young women and men have gained specific skills. tools and knowledge that enables them to 1) contribute to a culture of inclusion and diversity. and 2) lead and engage in efforts that contribute to a youth culture of active citizenship.
